8463925_syn_1:
Procedure: EBUS-TBNA + Ion Robotic Bronch.
- EBUS: Stations 4R, 7, 10R sampled (Pos for SCC).
- Ion: Navigated to RUL mass. REBUS confirmed. Bx x7.
- ROSE: Squamous Cell CA.
- Plan: Oncology.
8463925_syn_2: Operative Summary: A combined staging and diagnostic procedure was performed for a suspected right upper lobe malignancy. Endobronchial ultrasound (EBUS) guided transbronchial needle aspiration of stations 4R, 7, and 10R confirmed N2 disease (squamous cell carcinoma). Subsequently, the Ion robotic platform was utilized to navigate to the 3.2 cm RUL mass. Radial EBUS confirmation was obtained prior to extensive sampling.
8463925_syn_3:
Codes:
- 31653: EBUS TBNA 3+ stations (4R, 7, 10R).
- 31628: Robotic TBBX of RUL mass.
- 31627: Navigation.
- 31654: Radial EBUS.
Note: High complexity staging and diagnostic procedure.
8463925_syn_4:
Resident Note:
- EBUS scope: 4R, 7, 10R biopsies -> All SCC.
- Ion Robot: Drove to RUL lesion.
- Radial EBUS: Concentric view.
- Biopsy: 7 passes.
- Dx: Stage IIIA SCC.
8463925_syn_5: tyrone jackson here for staging. did ebus first hit 4r 7 and 10r all positive for squamous. then used the ion robot for the rul mass. found it with radial ebus took a bunch of biopsies. patient has stage 3a disease referral to onc.
8463925_syn_6: EBUS-TBNA of stations 4R, 7, and 10R plus Ion robotic bronchoscopy with radial EBUS and biopsy of an RUL mass. Nodal staging was positive for squamous cell carcinoma. Robotic navigation allowed for successful sampling of the primary lesion.
8463925_syn_7:
[Indication] RUL mass, staging.
[Anesthesia] General.
[Description] EBUS-TBNA stations 4R, 7, 10R (31653). Ion Nav (31627) to RUL mass. REBUS (31654). TBBX (31628).
[Plan] Oncology/Rad Onc.
8463925_syn_8: We performed a staging EBUS followed by a robotic biopsy for [REDACTED]. The EBUS confirmed cancer in the mediastinal and hilar lymph nodes. We then used the Ion robot to biopsy the main tumor in the right upper lobe. The diagnosis is squamous cell carcinoma.
8463925_syn_9: EBUS-TBNA of three nodal stations plus Ion robotic bronchoscopy with radial EBUS and sampling of an RUL mass. We aspirated the lymph nodes. We navigated to the RUL tumor and harvested tissue.
8463925:
**Quick Bronch Summary Note**

Pt: [REDACTED] | 68M | MRN: [REDACTED]
Date: [REDACTED]
Doc: Martinez + Wilson (fellow)

**Why:** RUL mass 3.2cm + nodes (4R, 7, 10R all PET+)

**What we did:**
EBUS first â†’ got stations 4R, 7, 10R
Then Ion robotic to RUL mass

**EBUS results (ROSE by Dr. Park):**
- 4R (18mm): Positive for squamous cell ca, 4 passes
- 7 (21mm): Positive squamous, 5 passes
- 10R (16mm): Positive squamous, 3 passes

**Ion to RUL:**
Registration good (error 1.2mm)
REBUS concentric pattern, 29mm lesion
CBCT confirmed position
Got 7 biopsies + 3 brushes

**ROSE (primary):** Squamous cell carcinoma, matches nodes

**Stage:** IIIA (T2aN2M0) - ipsilateral mediast + hilar nodes positive

**Complications:** None
**CXR:** No PTX

**Next:**
- Brain MRI
- Tumor board
- Chemo/rad (not surgical)
- F/u 1 wk

Martinez MD
